title: Support for SkColor HSV <-> RGB
body:
It'd be great to wrap these Skia functions from SkColor: `SkRGBToHSV` and `SkHSVToColor`.

I've already started work on this, but I figured there should be an issue open so that it can be discussed. One problem I'm having already (it would be great if someone can chime in) is how to add a new file `sk_color.{cpp,h}` to the Skia C API. I've modified the `core.gypi` file to include it, and it is compiling, but doesn't seem to be linking it into `libskia_windows.dll`.

comments.author: tdenniston
comments.body: I figured out the linking issue. It also occurs to me that we could simply reimplement these functions in SkiaSharp instead of calling into the library. Any thoughts on this?

comments.author: bholmes
comments.body:
Agree.  It feels like these methods should be implemented in C#.  

https://github.com/mono/SkiaSharp/blob/master/binding/Binding/Definitions.cs#L72

comments.author: bholmes
comments.body:
How about

`static public SKColor FromHSV (...)`

Can not think of a nice way to get HSV off hand.  Could be `GetHSV (out h, out s, out v)`

comments.author: tdenniston
comments.body: Could do a subclass approach, `SKColorHSV : SKColor` with implicit conversion to RGB. That starts to depart from Skia, though, which does not have a separate class.

comments.author: migueldeicaza
comments.body:
Add the `FromHSV` method and `GetHSV` approaches.

Some code from Mono that implements bits of this:

https://github.com/mono/mono/blob/master/mcs/class/System.Drawing/System.Drawing/Color.cs#L231

comments.author: mattleibow
comments.body: Added support for to/from both HSV and HSL in 555a6263951e78c692be8b441625a4117f060ef1
